description: Mentioned only by Irwin, who describes it as having �wooden bars, single stroke�. The bars are struck by hammers actuated by an electric or pneumatic mechanism. This stop is usually found on theatre organs.
examplesDescription: Marimba Harp 8' (repeating), Solo; Irvine Auditorium, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA; Austin 1926.
